dt.t: A day or two later, Brendan's crew landed on an island where they celebrated Good Friday and Easter. Here they found flocks of white sheep bigger than oxen, and a lamb which they slaughtered for the {wi}paschal{/wi} feast.

dt: {bc}the 14th day of a lunar month occurring on or next after March 21 according to a fixed set of ecclesiastical calendar rules and without regard to the real moon

shortdef: the 14th day of a lunar month occurring on or next after March 21 according to a fixed set of ecclesiastical calendar rules and without regard to the real moon

dt: {bc}a lamb slain and eaten during the Passover celebration in ancient Judaism

shortdef: a lamb slain and eaten during the Passover celebration in ancient Judaism
